str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To talk with, discuss. From sun and laleo; to talk together, i.e. Converse.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of sumboulos; advisement; specially, a deliberative body, i.e. The provincial assessors or lay-court.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Of Latin origin; Caesar, a title of the Roman emperor.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Of Latin origin; Caesar, a title of the Roman emperor.
